metadata.title: CVE-2023-29449 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
JavaScript preprocessing, webhooks and global scripts can causeuncontrolled CPU, memory, and disk I/O utilization.Preprocessing/webhook/global script configuration and testing are onlyavailable to Administrative roles (Admin and Superadmin). Administrativeprivileges should be typically granted to users who need to perform tasksthat require more control over the system. The security risk is limitedbecause not all users have this level of access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-agent2 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
zabbix-web-service - 1:6.0.29+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.0.29+dfsg-1').
